artist: William Gray Purcell George Grant Elmslie John S. Bradstreet and Company
image_copyright: Copyright of the artist%2C artist%27s estate%2C or assignees
text: This chair is not as refined as others in this gallery. But it came from a well-designed summer house for the Decker family near Lake Minnetonka, where its humble pine and durable horsehair—once deep blue, now faded—were considered appropriate for a relaxing retreat. Purcell noted, “Mr. Decker spent all the money that was necessary to make our architectural thesis complete in all its detail.”
title: Side chair, one of four
